newsitem.title: USA: Lear sets first China joint venture.
newsitem.headline: Lear sets first China joint venture.

text.p: Lear Corp., marking its first expansion into the Chinese vehicle market, said Wednesday it signed a letter of intent to form a joint venture with state-owned Jiangling Motors Co. Ltd.
The 50-50 venture, Jiangling-Lear Interior System Co. Ltd., will will provide seats and interior trim for trucks from Isuzu Motors Ltd. and transit vans from Ford Motor Co.
Lear said the new company will operate from an existing facility in Nanchang, China, and make seats for 150,000 vehicles a year.
The companies held a signing ceremony at Lear's Ford division headquarters in Allen Park, Mich.
Lear said annual vehicle sales in China are expected to triple over the next few years to more than three million from a current 1.2 million.
Lear is the world's largest independent supplier of automotive interior systems, with 1995 sales of $4.7 billion.
Jiangling makes light trucks for Isuzu. It will begin production in late 1997 of a light truck for Ford that will be sold in Europe.
Lear's stock rose 62.5 cents to $34 on the New York Stock Exchange at mid-afternoon.
